title: Field properties
content:
The Fields tab displays the fields (including calculated fields and associations) for the record type selected in the drop-down list at the top of the page.

A field marked with a lock is a locked system field that you cannot edit (except for the Multilingual label property).

  • To view only the custom fields for the record, click Custom.
  • To view only the calculated fields, click Calculated. For more information on calculated fields, see Calculated fields.
  • To view all the fields for the record, click All.

    The first column of the fields table displays indicator tags for the fields:

    Analytic field. You can add this field to analytic reports.
    Operational field. You can add this field to operational reports and operational raw data reports.
    In addition to fields marked with the tag, the Id field and the Data Domains field can also be used in operational raw reports.

    When you select a field, its properties appear in the right pane.

    Property Description
    Name

    The name of the field. This field is mandatory.

    The name of out-of-the-box fields is always in upper camel case. For example: ChangeCausedByRequest. You must follow this naming style. The names of all custom fields must end with _c. The system adds this suffix automatically. You do not have to enter it manually.

    UpperCamelCase is a naming convention where each word in a phrase starts with an uppercase letter, and there are no spaces or underscores between words.
    Domain This property is read-only.
    System This is a system field. You cannot edit a system field or select it for a custom field.
    Multilingual label Service Management displays the label of the field in the user interface. This field is mandatory.
    Logical type The field type. This field is mandatory. For more information, see the Logical type details section.
    Enable sort The user can sort the field when it appears in a record list by clicking the column header.
    Enable search

    The user can filter and generate reports using this field. You can define up to two custom fields per record as Enable search.
    Encrypted Only members of the selected encryption domain can view the field if they select it. Only relevant for fields of type MEDIUM_TEXT, LARGE_TEXT, and RICH_TEXT.
    Encryption domain Select the encryption domain used for this field. This field only appears when you select Encrypted. For more information on encryption domains, see Encryption domains.
    Enforce uniqueness The value entered in the field must be unique. This property can only be set during the creation of custom fields.
    Required Users must give this property a value when editing it from the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.
    Read only Users cannot modify the value of this property through the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.
    Hidden The property is hidden from forms and grids on the user interface. This setting does not affect backend API calls.
    Tooltip The text that appears when you hover over the field.
    Placeholder The text that appears when the field is empty. You can use this to give instructions or reminders to users.
    Enable number formatting When selected, number formatting is applied to numeric fields. For example, the system displays 1,000 instead of 1000. Ensure to turn on the Number formatting option in Application settings. For more information on Number formatting, see Number formatting section under Application settings topic.
    Reference to If any of the Logical type fields are ENTITY_LINK, ENUM, or ENUM_SET, provide a reference to the linked entity.

    When you select an association, its properties appear in the right pane.

    Property Description
    Name

    The name of the association. This property is mandatory.

    The name of out-of-the-box associations is always in upper camel case. For example: ChangeCausedByRequest. You must follow this naming style. The names of all custom associations must end with _c. The system adds this suffix automatically. You do not have to enter it manually.
    Multilingual label

    The label of the association displayed in the user interface of the source record type.

    This property is mandatory.
    Opposite label

    The label of the association displayed in the user interface of the target record type.

    This property is mandatory.
    Logical type MANY2MANY
    Target entity The target record type of the association.

    Logical type details

    The table applies to both out-of-the-box and custom record types.
    Type Description Maximum length Search 5 Sort 6 Maximum number of fields per record 7
    SMALL_TEXT Text 140 Yes Yes 50 (SMALL_TEXT, MEDIUM_TEXT, EMAIL, and URL combined)
    MEDIUM_TEXT Text 5009 No Yes
    EMAIL Text 254 No Yes
    URL Text 2,048 No No
    MULTI_LANG_TEXT2 Text 140 No No
    BOOLEAN Boolean - Yes Yes 40
    LARGE_TEXT Text Up to 1,000,0009, 10 No No 50 (LARGE_TEXT, RICH_TEXT, and COMPLEX_TYPE combined)
    RICH_TEXT1 Text Up to 1,000,0009, 10 No No
    COMPLEX_TYPE2 Text 1,000,000 No No
    IMAGE2 Text 2,048 No No 40
    INTEGER Numeric - integer -2,147,483,647 to 2,147,483,647 Yes Yes 20
    DOUBLE Numeric - double - Yes Yes 25 (DOUBLE and PERCENTAGE combined)
    PERCENTAGE Numeric - double - Yes Yes
    DATE Date - Yes Yes 15 (DATE and DATE_TIME combined)
    DATE_TIME Date and time - Yes Yes
    ENUM3 Enumeration value - Yes Yes 25
    ENUM_SET8 Enumeration values - Yes No 15
    ENTITY_LINK4 Record reference - Yes Yes 30 custom fields 
    MANY2MANY Record reference - No No

    This table applies to both out-of-the-box and custom record types.

    1 RICH_TEXT fields include the capability to copy and paste images.

    2 You may not add this type of field for a custom field.

    3 The definitions of the values for ENUM fields are in the Lists module. For more information, see Lists.

    4 You may only select an ENTITY_LINK of Person, Group, or customized records for a custom field by default. If you want to set up record references to other record types, select On in Enable a custom entity link between two out-of-the-box record types field in Application settings.

    5 If the entry in this column is Yes, you can filter the record using this property.

    6 If the entry in this column is Yes, you can sort the record using this property.

    7 The number of additional custom fields of that type you can add to an out-of-the-box record.

    8 Allows you to add up to 300 values. For more information, see Lists. 

    9 The maximum length of encrypted fields is lower than the limit for unencrypted fields of the same type.

    10 The maximum size of a record containing such fields is 1,000,000.

    Non-customizable record types

    The fields of the following record types are not customizable:

    • Dashboard Definition
    • Entitlement rule
    • Fulfillment plan
    • Group target sets
    • Record Target Status
    • Service Level Target
    • Stockroom
    • Target Definition
    • Target Measurement
    • Target Set
    • Task delegation configuration
    • Time Period
